newsitem.title: SPAIN: Time Warner in talks with Telefonica - report.
newsitem.headline: Time Warner in talks with Telefonica - report.

text.p: Time Warner and DirecTV, a unit of Hughes Electronics, are in talks with Spain's Telefonica to participate in its digital satellite broadcasting project, financial daily Expansion said on Tuesday.

The newspaper said Jeffrey Schlesinger, president of Time Warner unit Warner Bros. International Television, had been in contact with Telefonica as well as Celso Acevedo, vice-chairman of international development at DirecTV.

Telefonica declined to confirm talks with Time Warner and DirecTV specifically, although it said it had held discussions with international operators to increase the content and technology potential of its project, Expansion said.
Telefonica is currently negotiating with Spain's major television networks to create a digital TV platform for Spain, of which it wants to own between 35 and 40 percent, the newspaper added.

Time Warner was reported in September to be in discussions with Radio Television Espanola (RTVE) to launch eight digital television channels with potential partners Rupert Murdoch, Mexico's Televisa and Brazil's O Globo.
DirecTV last month struck a deal with Spanish pay TV giant Sogecable to jointly exploit a digital TV platform in Spain.
